Giuliani seeks bankruptcy after $148 mln judgment in defamation case -filingTrump ally Rudy Giuliani filed for bankruptcy on Thursday, days after a jury decided he must pay more than $148 million in damages to two former Georgia election workers he defamed by falsely accusing them of helping to rig the 2020 election. Thu, 21 Dec 2023 17:44:20 GMT V7OCJOZNABIEBFHP3XMV5KZYGI https://www.reuters.com/legal/giuliani-seeks-bankruptcy-after-148-mln-judgment-defamation-case-filing-2023-12-21/Reuters合法的
Russia sentences ex-government minister to 12 years in prison for embezzlementA Russian court on Thursday sentenced former minister Mikhail Abyzov to 12 years in jail, finding him guilty of fraud and organising a criminal group, state-run news agencies reported. Bosnia's top court head, ex-spy chief detained in wiretapping affairThe head of Bosnia's state court and the former head of the spy agency are to be remanded in custody for one month over alleged wiretapping of the court's judges and investigators, a judge ruled on Thursday. Ahead of UN vote, US says bid to boost Gaza aid could slow deliveriesAhead of a likely vote on Thursday, the United States said there are "serious and widespread concerns" that the current draft of a U.N. Security Council proposal that aims to boost humanitarian aid to the Gaza Strip could actually slow down deliveries.
